basics.name: Jeffrey Fabian
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: Fullstack software engineer with 5+ years of experience. While my professional focus is building great software products, I also write about wealth, run an Ethereum validator, make stuff out of wood and snowboard.

highlights: Building an intelligent CRM empowering over 250K small businesses make better financial decisions
Introduced user wallet account abstraction — combining passwordless email signup and self-custodial wallet authentication — to onboard over 1000 new creators and fans to the platform
Led engineering intiative to create new job infrastructure to support processing and scheduling long-running tasks using Express, tRPC, BullMQ, and Redis

Implemented platform-wide creator subscription notifications end to end — from the customizable subscribe button embedded on every creator's site to the hundreds of emails sent to fans when an NFT drops, new content is published, etc.
Led a small squad of 3 engineers to build a partner referral system that has generated over $250,000 in payouts since its inception
Implemented the data layer for a learning management system (LMS) to asynchronously ingest and update partner data using Google Pub/Sub and Cloud Spanner
Implemented a series of Terraform modules to enable 25+ engineering teams to seamlessly deploy their services to AWS Fargate (Containerized Serverless Compute)
Cut payment processing costs by 25% for the Mastermind Assistant Alexa skill by implementing an Amazon Pay Servlet

volunteer.summary: Code Nation equips students in under-resourced high schools with the skills, experiences, and connections that together create access to careers in technology.
highlights: Taught HTML/CSS/JS to high school students at Wadleigh Secondary School For The Performing & Visual Arts

awards.title: Palantir Future Scholarship
awards.summary: The Palantir Future Scholarship celebrates and supports students from underrepresented racial/ethnic groups in STEM who are beginning careers in technology. I was one of 10 scholarship recipients and was invited to visit Palantir's Washington, D.C. office for a full-day, all-expenses paid, developmental workshop.

awards.title: QuestBridge National College Match
awards.summary: The QuestBridge National College Match is a college and scholarship that helps outstanding low-income high school seniors gain admission and full four-year scholarships to the nation's most selective colleges. I was one of 27 students matched to attend Columbia University.

publications.name: Money Flows
publications.summary: ...[Every] financial decision sets off a chain reaction of socioeconomic activity where money inevitably leaves our immediate control and becomes subject to the invisible forces of our existing financial infrastructure. Wealth is about having stake in this financial infrastructure — whether that’s in the form of financially supporting what already exists, creating new value channels that others can benefit from or doing the work that’s necessary to make the system better as a whole.

projects.name: Second Generation
projects.summary: A newsletter that aims to capture my evolving thoughts on wealth for first-generation college graduates
highlights: Launched a newsletter to capture my evolving thoughts on wealth for first-generation college graduates
Building a members-only, crypto staking portfolio manager

projects.name: Rocket Pool
projects.summary: Rocket Pool is a decentralized Ethereum staking protocol. My role as a Node Operator involves securely managing physical infrastructure to ensure 24/7 uptime and efficient processing of Ethereum transactions.

projects.name: APM Map
projects.summary: A resource directory for students and early-career professionals looking to break into product management.
